author: ghudson
msg: Pipeline change-dir-prop, add-file, open-file, apply-textdelta, and
change-file-prop operations by delaying error exits until close-dir or
close-file time.  In order to pipeline open-file, we invert the way
file and directory tokens are created; now you create them when you
request to create or open a file or directory, instead of receiving
one when you successfully do so.  ra_svn_baton_t now stores a pointer
back to the editor baton so that we can generate unique tokens in the
This is an incompatible protocol change.
(open-root, add-dir, open-dir, add-file, open-file): Generate token
command response; errors will be reported at close-dir or
(apply-textdelta): Eliminate second command response; same reasoning.
(ra_svn_edit_baton_t): Add next_token field for making unique tokens.
(ra_svn_baton_t): Add eb field so that we can get at the next_token
field of the edit baton in add-dir/open-dir/add-file/open-file.
(ra_svn_token_entry_t): Add err field for tracking delayed errors.
(make_token): Move from producer to consumer; just generate a
ra_svn_open_file): Generate token instead of receiving one.
(clear_token_err): Helper function to clean up delayed errors when
(store_token): Renamed from make_token.  Receive the token string
rather than making it up.  Return the token entry instead of the
ra_svn_handle_open_file): Receive token instead of generating it.
send command response; store error for close_dir/close_file.
store error instead.  (Much simpler this way, luckily.)
delayed error before actually trying to close the dir or file.

author: ghudson
msg: Update ra_svn protocol document for revs 5554, 4743, and 5893.

author: ghudson
msg: Fix error-handling behavior of get-file and apply-textdelta.  This is
(get-file): Specify a second command response for errors.
(apply-textdelta): Document a second command response for errors; we've
(ra_svn_get_file): Read an extra command response to find out about
(ra_svn_handle_apply_textdelta): If we get an error from
svn_stream_write, save it and return it in the final command
(get_file): Send a second command response with an error status, in
case we encounter an error while reading the file text.
(log_cmd): Be more careful about cleaning up errors.

author: striker
msg: Improve the helpful hints for those missing apr*.
(SVN_DOWNLOAD_APRUTIL): note that autogen.sh needs to be rerun
(SVN_DOWNLOAD_APR): note that autogen.sh needs to be rerun
if you download apr; note that you may need apr-util as well.
